metadata.titleCn: 黑河生态水文遥感试验：水文气象观测网数据集（混合林站自动气象站-2017）
metadata.description:
The data set contains meteorological element observation data from January 1, 2017 to December 31, 2017 at the downstream mixed forest station of heihe hydrometeorological observation network.The station is located at sidao bridge, dalaihubu town, ejin banner, Inner Mongolia.The longitude and latitude of the observation point are 101.1335e, 41.9903n and 874m above sea level.The air temperature and relative humidity sensors are located at 28m, facing due north.The barometer is installed in the anti-skid box on the ground;Tilting bucket rain gauge installed at 28m;The wind speed and direction sensor is located at 28m, facing due north.The four-component radiometer is installed at 24m, facing due south;Two infrared thermometers are installed at 24m, facing due south and the probe facing vertically downward.Two photosynthetically active radiators were installed at a position of 24m, facing due south, with one probe vertically upward and one probe vertically downward.The soil temperature probe is buried at 0cm of the surface and 2cm, 4cm, 10cm, 20cm, 40cm, 60cm, 100cm, 160cm, 200cm and 240cm underground, 2m to the south of the meteorological tower.The soil water probe is buried 2cm, 4cm, 10cm, 20cm, 40cm, 60cm, 100cm, 160cm, 200cm and 240cm underground, 2m to the south of the meteorological tower.The soil heat flow plates (3 pieces) are buried in the ground 6cm underground, 2m to the south of the meteorological tower.
Observation items are: air temperature and humidity (Ta_28m, RH_28m) (unit: c, percentage), pressure (Press) (unit: hundred mpa), precipitation (Rain) (unit: mm), wind speed (WS_28m) (unit: m/s), wind (WD_28m) (unit: degrees), the radiation of four component (DR, UR, DLR_Cor, ULR_Cor, Rn) (unit: watts per square meter), the surface radiation temperature (IRT_1, IRT_2) (unit:C), soil heat flux (Gs_1, Gs_2, Gs_3) (in watts/m2), soil temperature (Ts_0cm, Ts_2cm, Ts_4cm, Ts_10cm, Ts_20cm, Ts_40cm, Ts_60cm, Ts_100cm, Ts_160cm, Ts_200cm, Ts_240cm) (in:C), soil moisture (Ms_2cm, Ms_4cm, Ms_10cm, Ms_20cm, Ms_40cm, Ms_60cm, Ms_100cm, Ms_160cm, Ms_200cm, Ms_240cm) (unit: volumetric water content, percentage), upward and downward photosynthetically active radiation (PAR_up, PAR_down) (unit: micromole/sq.s).
Processing and quality control of observed data :(1) ensure 144 pieces of data every day (every 10min), and mark by -6999 in case of data missing;Due to the sensor problem, the data of wind speed and infrared temperature between May 26 and July 9, 2017 were missing.(2) excluding the time with duplicate records;(3) data that obviously exceeds the physical significance or the range of the instrument is deleted;(4) the part marked with red letter in the data is the data in question;(5) date and time have the same format, and date and time are in the same column.For example, the time is: 2017-9-1010:30;(6) the naming rule is: AWS+ site name.
For information of hydrometeorological network or station, please refer to Li et al. (2013), and for observation data processing, please refer to Liu et al. (2011).

该数据集包含了2017年1月1日至2017年12月31日黑河水文气象观测网下游混合林站气象要素观测数据。站点位于内蒙古额济纳旗达来呼布镇四道桥，下垫面是胡杨与柽柳。观测点的经纬度是101.1335E,41.9903N，海拔874m。空气温度、相对湿度传感器架设在28m处，朝向正北；气压计安装在地面上的防撬箱内；翻斗式雨量计安装在28m处；风速与风向传感器架设在28m，朝向正北；四分量辐射仪安装在24m处，朝向正南；两个红外温度计安装在24m处，朝向正南，探头朝向是垂直向下；两个光合有效辐射仪安装在24m处，朝向正南，探头垂直向上和向下方向各一个；土壤温度探头埋设在地表0cm和地下2cm、4cm、10cm、20cm、40cm、60cm、100cm、160cm、200cm和240cm处，在距离气象塔2m的正南方；土壤水分探头埋设在地下2cm、4cm、10cm、20cm、40cm、60cm、100cm、160cm、200cm和240cm处，在距离气象塔2m的正南方；土壤热流板（3块）依次埋设在地下6cm处，在距离气象塔2m的正南方。
观测项目有：空气温湿度（Ta_28m、RH_28m）(单位：摄氏度、百分比)、气压（Press）(单位：百帕)、降水量（Rain）(单位：毫米)、风速（WS_28m）(单位：米/秒)、风向（WD_28m）(单位：度)、四分量辐射（DR、UR、DLR_Cor、ULR_Cor、Rn）(单位：瓦/平方米)、地表辐射温度（IRT_1、IRT_2）(单位：摄氏度)、土壤热通量（Gs_1、Gs_2、Gs_3）(单位：瓦/平方米)、土壤温度（Ts_0cm、Ts_2cm、Ts_4cm、Ts_10cm、Ts_20cm、Ts_40cm、Ts_60cm、Ts_100cm、Ts_160cm、Ts_200cm、Ts_240cm）(单位：摄氏度)、土壤水分（Ms_2cm、Ms_4cm、Ms_10cm、Ms_20cm、Ms_40cm、Ms_60cm、Ms_100cm、Ms_160cm、Ms_200cm、Ms_240cm）(单位：体积含水量，百分比)、向上与向下光合有效辐射（PAR_up、PAR_down）(单位：微摩尔/平方米秒)。
观测数据的处理与质量控制：（1）确保每天144个数据（每10min），若出现数据的缺失，则由-6999标示；由于传感器的问题，在2017.5.26-7.09之间风速和红外温度1数据缺失；（2）剔除有重复记录的时刻；（3）删除了明显超出物理意义或超出仪器量程的数据；（4）数据中以红字标示的部分为有疑问的数据；（5）日期和时间的格式统一，并且日期、时间在同一列。如，时间为：2017-9-10 10:30；（6）命名规则为：AWS+站点名称。
水文气象网或站点信息请参考Li et al. (2013)，观测数据处理请参考Liu et al. (2011)。

background: The two-source energy balance (TSEB) model was successfully applied to estimate evaporation (E), transpiration (T), and evapotranspiration (ET) for land covered with vegetation, which has significantly important applications for the terrestrial water cycle and water resource management. One-source evapotranspiration estimation models combine the soil–vegetation components into a single source. However, in real landscape conditions, the surface is heterogeneous and contains a mixture of soil and vegetation having different temperatures and resistance to energy exchange. Therefore, one-source models explicitly cannot estimate the surface evapotranspiration accurately because the effect of.

Shuttleworth and Wallace proposed a typical two-source evapotranspiration estimation model in which the energy partition is assumed to occur in both “the above canopy” and “the under soil” cases. Water vapor and heat meet over the reference height in the interior of the canopy. Moreover, the mixed water vapor and heat can only exit through the top of the canopy; the total heat flux is in addition to the fluxes coming from every surface layer. However, the model is complex, having over five resistances that cannot be accurately calculated. In addition, the model includes required parameters and observations that cannot be readily obtained from operational satellite- and ground-based data; therefore, the range of applications of the model is limited.

The TSEB model has undergone several revisions, improving the estimation of soil and canopy net radiation, the aerodynamic resistance of the soil surface, the fractional vegetation coverage observed at the radiometer view angle, the distribution of regional-scale near-surface air temperature, and soil and canopy component temperatures. Because the TSEB model only requires the surface energy balance model with a single measurement of land surface temperature, the original model and subsequent refinements have been widely used to estimate E and T under a wide variety of vegetation types, vegetation coverage, climates, and spatial scales. However, most studies have only evaluated the total fluxes or ET (soil plus canopy) in comparison with measurements using the Bowen ratio–energy balance system, the eddy covariance (EC) system, or the large aperture scintillometer.

Accurately estimating surface fluxes in a strongly advective irrigated agricultural area is a particularly challenging task and is even more difficult when the EC flux measurements of H and LE have an incomplete energy balance closure with respect to the available energy Rn−G0. The previous sensitivity studies found that the TSEB model performance is mainly affected by the uncertainty in surface–air temperature difference. Sometimes, this difference is dominant due to the errors in determining the surface soil and vegetation component temperatures from the surface composite radiometric temperature. In this letter, it is shown that there is an overestimation of the component temperatures compared with the observed composite radiometric. This often leads to the most crucial effect on the TSEB model performance. In addition, another factor is the strong advective environment in this region.
research objective: In this letter, the ground-measured soil and canopy component temperatures were used to estimate E, T, and ET, which were better validated with observed ratios of E (E/ET%) and T (T/ET%) using the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes, and the ET measurements using an eddy covariance (EC) system.

The objective of this letter is to estimate E, T, and ET using the soil and canopy component temperatures observed via a high-resolution thermal camera as inputs to a series TSEB model and to subsequently better validate E, T, and ET using a combination of the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotope technique and EC measurements.
challenges: However, the current composite temperature separation approaches are limited in their effectiveness in arid regions. Moreover, E and T are difficult to measure on the ground.

Errors in the derived component temperature were primarily caused by image classification errors; these classification errors varied with vegetation abundance. The higher uncertainty of H estimation is not only caused by the uncertainty of the TSEB model but also due to the increased uncertainty of the EC system, which is 18% when the mean H is small in the irrigated farmland. Due to image pixel classification errors, soil pixels were counted as vegetation pixels, which produced an overestimation of the canopy temperature under the developing vegetation abundance. Alternatively, ignoring atmospheric upwelling radiation and transmittance could have produced the uncertainties in the estimated temperatures. In addition, the estimated uncertainty of the incoming short- and long-wave radiation transmittances through the canopy may be another source of Rn estimation errors.
methods: In this letter, the field observations were obtained from the Daman superstation installed in the central oasis, which is a 40-m boundary layer tower located at 100.3722° E, 38.8555° N and at an elevation of 1556 m. The meteorological parameters were measured every 10 min and included air temperature, wind speed, humidity at 5 m over the ground, four-component radiations (measured at 12 m above the ground using a four-component radiometer), and turbulent fluxes (measured at 4.5 m above the ground using an EC system with a sampling frequency of 10 Hz). The soil heat fluxes were measured using three heat plates located 6 cm under the ground. A Fluke Ti55 thermal infrared camera was manually operated on a 25-m-high platform on a boundary layer tower to measure the thermal radiation of the cropland approximately every 120 min; the observations were collected as thermal images from approximately 07:00 to 19:00 China Standard Time (CST) during the daytime. The ground-based measurement data were applied to partition ET into E and T applying the Craig–Gordon model.

To evaluate the TSEB model accurately, the soil heat flux was using the ground measurement. In addition, the soil and canopy sensible heat fluxes were estimated using the series TSEB model, and their latent heat fluxes were calculated while solving the energy balance equations (1) and (2), respectively. The soil and canopy component temperatures were calculated using the images obtained with the thermal camera. To calculate the component temperatures, the visible and NIR images were classified into soil and canopy pixels using the maximum-likelihood method. Next, the soil and canopy directional brightness temperatures were exacted from the thermal images. Finally, the thermal infrared temperatures were converted to the radiation temperatures using the incoming long-wave radiation from the sky and the soil and canopy emissivities. Next, the simulated radiometric temperatures were validated against the surface radiometric temperatures, which were calculated according to the incoming long-wave radiation observed by the four-component radiometer.
dataset: The experimental area is an artificial oasis that is covered with maize, vegetables, and orchards. Data of day of year (DOY) 170, 173, 176, 192, 195, 231, 252, and 256 were used to determine ET and the ratios of E (E/ET%) and T (T/ET%) to ET during the Multi-Scale Observation Experiment on Evapotranspiration over heterogeneous land surfaces, which was part of the Heihe Water Allied Telemetry Experimental Research (HiWATER-MUSOEXE).
findings: Our results indicated that even under the strongly advective conditions, the TSEB model produced reliable estimates of the E/ET% and T/ET% ratios and of ET. The mean bias and root-mean-square error (RMSE) of E/ET% were 1% and 2%, respectively, and the mean bias and RMSE of T/ET% were −1% and 2%, respectively. In addition, the model exhibited relatively reliable estimates in the latent heat flux, with mean bias and RMSE values of 31 and 61 W·m−2, respectively, compared with the measurements from the EC system. These results demonstrated that a robust soil and vegetation component temperature calculation was crucial for estimating E, T, and ET. Moreover, the separate validation of E/ET% and T/ET% provides a good prospect for TSEB model improvements.

Our results demonstrated that the TSEB model using soil and canopy component radiometric temperatures, which were obtained from a high-precision thermal infrared camera, can be applied in a strongly advection-irrigated agricultural area. Notably, the results illustrated that the latent fluxes of the soil and vegetation components were successfully separated with reasonable accuracy, as assessed using ground-based measurements. The estimated E/ET% and E/ET% values agreed well with the values observed using the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes technique during the early, middle, and late growing seasons. In addition, the TSEB model produced reliable estimations of Rn, H, and LE; the mean biases of Rn, H, and LE were −18, 5, and 31 W ·m−2, respectively, and the RMSEs of Rn, H, and LE were 29, 19, and 61 W · m−2, respectively. This finding suggests that given accurate soil and vegetation component temperatures, E and T can be accurately separated from ET using the TSEB model.
backgroundCn: 双源能量平衡（TSEB）模型成功应用于估算植被覆盖土地的蒸发（E）、蒸腾（T）和蒸散（ET），这对陆地水循环和水资源管理具有重要意义。单源蒸散估算模型将土壤-植被组件合并为一个单一源。然而，在真实的景观条件下，表面是异质的，包含具有不同温度和能量交换阻力的土壤和植被的混合物。因此，单源模型显然无法准确估算表面蒸散，因为其影响。

Shuttleworth和Wallace提出了一种典型的双源蒸散发估算模型，该模型假设能量分配发生在“树冠上方”和“土壤下方”两种情况。水蒸气和热量在树冠内部的参考高度相遇。此外，混合的水蒸气和热量只能通过树冠顶部排出；总热通量是除了来自每个表层的通量之外的额外通量。然而，该模型复杂，具有超过五个无法准确计算的阻力。此外，该模型还包括一些所需的参数和观测数据，这些数据无法从操作卫星和地面数据中轻易获得；因此，该模型的应用范围受到限制。

TSEB模型经过多次修订，改善了土壤和冠层净辐射的估算、土壤表面的气动阻力、在辐射仪视角下观察到的植被覆盖度、区域尺度近地面气温的分布以及土壤和冠层组分的温度。由于TSEB模型只需要一个地表温度的单一测量来进行表面能量平衡模型的计算，因此原始模型及其后续改进已被广泛用于在各种植被类型、植被覆盖、气候和空间尺度下估算蒸散发（E）和温度（T）。然而，大多数研究仅评估了总通量或蒸散发（土壤加冠层），并与使用波 Bowen 比率-能量平衡系统、涡度协方差（EC）系统或大孔径闪烁仪的测量结果进行了比较。

在强烈的平流灌溉农业区，准确估计表面通量是一项特别具有挑战性的任务，当EC通量测量的潜热（LE）和感热（H）与可用能量（Rn−G0）之间存在能量平衡闭合不完全时，这一任务变得更加困难。之前的敏感性研究发现，TSEB模型的性能主要受到表面-空气温差不确定性的影响。有时，这一温差由于从表面复合辐射温度中确定表面土壤和植被组分温度的误差而占主导地位。本文显示，与观察到的复合辐射温度相比，组分温度存在过高估计。这往往对TSEB模型的性能产生最关键的影响。此外，该地区的强平流环境也是另一个因素。
research objectiveCn: 在这封信中，地面测量的土壤和冠层成分温度被用来估算蒸散（E）、蒸发（T）和蒸散发（ET），这些估算通过稳定的氧和氢同位素以及使用涡度协方差（EC）系统的ET测量结果进行了更好的验证，得到了E（E/ET%）和T（T/ET%）的观察比率。
这封信的目的是利用高分辨率热像仪观察到的土壤和冠层组件温度作为输入，通过一系列TSEB模型来估算蒸散发（E）、温度（T）和蒸散发总量（ET），并随后结合稳定氧和氢同位素技术以及涡度相关（EC）测量更好地验证E、T和ET。
challengesCn: 然而，目前的复合温度分离方法在干旱地区的有效性有限。此外，E和T在地面上难以测量。

导出组件温度的误差主要是由于图像分类错误引起的；这些分类错误随着植被丰度的变化而变化。H估计的不确定性不仅是由于TSEB模型的不确定性，还因为在灌溉农田中，当平均H较小时，EC系统的不确定性达到了18%。由于图像像素分类错误，土壤像素被错误地计为植被像素，这导致在植被丰度发展的情况下，冠层温度被高估。另一方面，忽略大气上行辐射和透射率可能导致估计温度的不确定性。此外，估计的通过冠层的入射短波和长波辐射透射率的不确定性可能是Rn估计误差的另一个来源。
methodsCn: 在这封信中，现场观测数据来自于安装在中央绿洲的达曼超级站，该站是一座40米高的边界层塔，位于东经100.3722°，北纬38.8555°，海拔1556米。气象参数每10分钟测量一次，包括地面5米高度的气温、风速、湿度，12米高度使用四分量辐射计测量的四分量辐射，以及使用采样频率为10 Hz的涡度相关系统在4.5米高度测量的湍流通量。土壤热通量通过位于地下6厘米的三个热板进行测量。一台Fluke Ti55热红外相机在边界层塔的25米高平台上手动操作，约每120分钟测量一次农田的热辐射；观测数据在中国标准时间（CST）白天07:00至19:00期间收集为热图像。基于地面测量数据，应用Craig-Gordon模型将蒸散发（ET）分解为蒸发（E）和蒸腾（T）。

为了准确评估TSEB模型，土壤热通量使用地面测量数据。此外，土壤和冠层的感热通量是通过系列TSEB模型估算的，而它们的潜热通量则通过求解能量平衡方程（1）和（2）计算得出。土壤和冠层的组件温度是使用热像仪获得的图像计算的。为了计算组件温度，使用最大似然法将可见光和近红外图像分类为土壤和冠层像素。接下来，从热图像中提取土壤和冠层的方向亮温。最后，利用来自天空的入射长波辐射和土壤及冠层的发射率将热红外温度转换为辐射温度。最后，模拟的辐射温度与根据四分量辐射计观测的入射长波辐射计算的表面辐射温度进行了验证。
datasetCn: 实验区域是一个人工绿洲，种植有玉米、蔬菜和果园。使用了第170、173、176、192、195、231、252和256天的数据来确定蒸散发（ET）以及蒸发（E/ET%）和蒸腾（T/ET%）相对于ET的比率，这些研究是在多尺度蒸散发观测实验中进行的，属于黑河水联合遥测实验研究（HiWATER-MUSOEXE）的一部分。
findingsCn: 我们的结果表明，即使在强烈的对流条件下，TSEB模型仍然能够可靠地估计E/ET%和T/ET%比率以及ET。E/ET%的平均偏差和均方根误差（RMSE）分别为1%和2%；而T/ET%的平均偏差和RMSE分别为−1%和2%。此外，该模型在潜热通量的估计上也表现出相对可靠的结果，与EC系统的测量值相比，平均偏差和RMSE值分别为31和61 W·m−2。这些结果表明，稳健的土壤和植被组件温度计算对于估计E、T和ET至关重要。此外，E/ET%和T/ET%的单独验证为TSEB模型的改进提供了良好的前景。

我们的结果表明，使用高精度热红外相机获得的土壤和冠层组件辐射温度的TSEB模型可以应用于强烈的平流灌溉农业区域。值得注意的是，结果表明土壤和植被组件的潜在通量成功地以合理的精度分离，经过地面测量的评估。估计的E/ET%和E/ET%值与在早期、中期和晚期生长季节使用稳定氧和氢同位素技术观察到的值一致。此外，TSEB模型对Rn、H和LE的估计也很可靠；Rn、H和LE的平均偏差分别为−18、5和31 W·m−2，Rn、H和LE的均方根误差（RMSE）分别为29、19和61 W·m−2。这一发现表明，给定准确的土壤和植被组件温度，E和T可以通过TSEB模型准确地从ET中分离出来。

background: Arid and semiarid regions represent approximately 30 % of the global terrestrial surface area (Dregne, 1991; Scanlon et al., 2006), and dryland expansion occurs under climate change, especially in developing countries (Huang et al., 2016). An oasis is a unique ecological landscape in arid and semi-arid areas that is not only the core of regions’ ecological environment but also the foundation of their economic development, especially in western China, which has been an important part of the “Silk Road” since ancient times. Oases comprising less than 10 % of the total area of arid regions support more than 90 % of the population in these regions of China (Chu et al., 2005; Li et al., 2016; Zhou et al., 2022). The oasis–desert system plays a crucial role in maintaining a stable ecological environment and agricultural productivity (Zhang and Zhao, 2015). Extensive studies have investigated energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas based on field and remote-sensing observations (Taha et al., 1991; Potchter et al., 2008; Xue et al., 2019; Wang et al., 2019; Zhou et al., 2022) and numerical simulations (Chu et al., 2005; Meng et al., 2009; Georgescu et al., 2011; Liu et al., 2020). In addition, oasis–desert areas located in semiarid regions have been found to be carbon sinks by previous researchers (Tagesson et al., 2016; Wang et al., 2019); thus, they can significantly affect the carbon balance of arid regions and play an increasingly important role within the global carbon cycle.
research objective: Therefore, it is critical to maintain the balance between oasis and desert systems in order to achieve the goal of sustainable oasis development. Understanding the basic characteristics of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems is important to achieve the goals of carbon peaking and carbon neutrality in the oasis–desert area and support the ecological security and sustainable development of the oasis. A quantitative understanding of the energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas is crucial to recognize the oasis–desert interactions and is significant to protect the ecological stability and socioeconomic development of oases; moreover, long-term observations are indispensable.
challenges: Inland river basins in arid and semiarid areas are facing the crisis of ecological environment degradation, such as the drying up of rivers and lakes, the degradation of natural vegetation, the intensification of land desertification, and the frequent occurrence of dust storms, especially in many inland river basins westward along the Silk Road, such as the Tarim River basin (Zhao et al., 2013), the Aral Sea basin (Stanev et al., 2004; Crétaux et al., 2009), and the Lake Urmia basin (Stone, 2015).
methods: In this study, we present a suite of observational datasets from artificial and natural oasis–desert systems that consist of long-term energy, water vapor, carbon and methane fluxes as well as auxiliary data involving hydrometeorology, vegetation, and soil parameters from 2012 to 2021. Half-hourly turbulent flux data were acquired by an eddy covariance system and scintillometer. The hydrometeorological data (including radiation, soil heat flux, and soil temperature profiles; gradients of air temperature and humidity and of wind speed and direction; and air pressure, precipitation, and soil moisture profiles) were observed from automatic weather stations with a 10 min average period as well as the groundwater table data. Moreover, vegetation and soil parameters were also supplemented in the datasets. The data processing and quality control procedure can be divided into data collection, data processing, and data archiving and sharing.
dataset: The study area comprises the middle and lower reaches of the HRB, located in the arid regions of western China, that receive water from the typical cryosphere of the upper reaches. A total of 11 land surface flux and meteorological stations have been established in these regions since 2012 – 2 superstations and 9 ordinary stations. The dataset of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange observations in oasis–desert areas reported in this study (including energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes; hydrometeorological data; and vegetation and soil parameters) is freely available from the National Tibetan Plateau Data Center.
backgroundCn: 干旱和半干旱地区约占全球陆地表面积的30%（Dregne, 1991；Scanlon et al., 2006），在气候变化的影响下，干旱地区的扩展尤其发生在发展中国家（Huang et al., 2016）。绿洲是干旱和半干旱地区独特的生态景观，不仅是这些地区生态环境的核心，也是经济发展的基础，特别是在中国西部，自古以来就一直是“丝绸之路”的重要组成部分。绿洲占干旱地区总面积的不到10%，却支持着中国这些地区90%以上的人口（Chu et al., 2005；Li et al., 2016；Zhou et al., 2022）。绿洲-沙漠系统在维持稳定的生态环境和农业生产力方面发挥着至关重要的作用（Zhang and Zhao, 2015）。大量研究基于实地和遥感观测（Taha et al., 1991；Potchter et al., 2008；Xue et al., 2019；Wang et al., 2019；Zhou et al., 2022）以及数值模拟（Chu et al., 2005；Meng et al., 2009；Georgescu et al., 2011；Liu et al., 2020）对绿洲-沙漠地区的能量、水汽和碳交换进行了广泛研究。此外，位于半干旱地区的绿洲-沙漠区域被先前的研究者发现是碳汇（Tagesson et al., 2016；Wang et al., 2019）；因此，它们可以显著影响干旱地区的碳平衡，并在全球碳循环中发挥越来越重要的作用。
research objectiveCn: 因此，维持绿洲与沙漠系统之间的平衡对于实现可持续绿洲发展的目标至关重要。了解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水汽和碳交换的基本特征，对于实现绿洲-沙漠地区的碳达峰和碳中和目标，以及支持绿洲的生态安全和可持续发展具有重要意义。对绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换的定量理解对于认识绿洲-沙漠之间的相互作用至关重要，并且对保护绿洲的生态稳定性和社会经济发展具有重要意义；此外，长期观测是不可或缺的。
challengesCn: 内陆河流流域在干旱和半干旱地区面临生态环境退化的危机，例如河流和湖泊干涸、自然植被退化、土地沙漠化加剧以及沙尘暴频发，尤其是在丝绸之路沿线的许多内陆河流流域，如塔里木河流域（赵等，2013）、咸海流域（Stanev等，2004；Crétaux等，2009）和乌尔米湖流域（Stone，2015）。
methodsCn: 在本研究中，我们呈现了一套来自人工和自然绿洲–沙漠系统的观测数据集，包括2012年至2021年的长期能量、水蒸气、碳和甲烷通量，以及涉及水文气象、植被和土壤参数的辅助数据。半小时的湍流通量数据通过涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪获取。水文气象数据（包括辐射、土壤热通量和土壤温度剖面；空气温度和湿度的梯度，风速和风向的梯度；空气压力、降水和土壤湿度剖面）通过自动气象站以10分钟的平均周期进行观测，同时还记录了地下水位数据。此外，数据集中还补充了植被和土壤参数。数据处理和质量控制程序可分为数据收集、数据处理和数据归档与共享。
datasetCn: 研究区域包括位于中国西部干旱地区的HRB中下游，水源来自上游典型的冰冻圈。自2012年以来，在这些地区建立了共11个地表通量和气象站——2个超级站和9个普通站。本研究报告的绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换观测数据集（包括能量、水汽和碳通量；水文气象数据；以及植被和土壤参数）可从国家西藏高原数据中心免费获取。

Feature Specification.AnswerCn: 图像分类错误、地表-空气温度差的不确定性、土壤和植被组分温度估计的错误、植被丰度、大气条件、穿过树冠的辐射透过率的不确定性。

Quantification.QuestionEn: What is the total number of observation stations established in the Heihe River Basin for energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange measurements?
Quantification.QuestionCn: 在黑河流域建立的用于能量、水汽和碳交换测量的观测站总数是多少？

Comparison.QuestionEn: What are the differences in data quality control procedures between the hydrometeorological dataset in the mixed forest station and the oasis–desert systems?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 混合森林站的水文气象数据集与绿洲-沙漠系统的数据质量控制程序之间有什么区别？
Comparison.AnswerEn: In the mixed forest station, data quality control includes ensuring complete data sets, removing duplicates, and handling missing data, while the oasis–desert systems involve a more comprehensive approach with data collection, processing, archiving, and sharing steps, including managing half-hourly flux data and integrating auxiliary data like vegetation and soil parameters.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 在混合森林站，数据质量控制包括确保数据集完整、去除重复数据和处理缺失数据，而绿洲-沙漠系统则涉及更全面的方法，包括数据收集、处理、归档和共享步骤，管理半小时的通量数据，并整合辅助数据，如植被和土壤参数。

Comparison.QuestionEn: How do the challenges of measuring energy and water vapor fluxes in oasis-desert areas differ from those in a mixed forest environment?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠地区，测量能量和水汽通量的挑战与混合森林环境中的挑战有何不同？
Comparison.AnswerEn: In oasis-desert areas, challenges include dealing with ecological degradation and maintaining energy and carbon balance, especially under arid conditions. In a mixed forest, the challenges focus more on sensor issues leading to data gaps and ensuring accurate data representation across different environmental conditions.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 在绿洲-沙漠地区，面临的挑战包括应对生态退化和维持能量与碳平衡，尤其是在干旱条件下。在混合森林中，挑战更多集中在传感器问题导致的数据缺口，以及确保在不同环境条件下准确的数据表示。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: Why is it crucial to address the uncertainty in surface-air temperature difference for accurate energy balance models?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 为什么在准确的能量平衡模型中解决地表空气温度差的不确定性至关重要？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: The uncertainty in surface-air temperature difference is a dominant factor affecting the TSEB model performance. Errors in determining component temperatures from composite radiometric temperature can lead to overestimation of these temperatures, significantly impacting the model's accuracy in estimating surface fluxes, especially in strongly advective environments.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 表面空气温度差的不确定性是影响TSEB模型性能的主要因素。从复合辐射温度中确定组分温度的错误可能导致这些温度的高估，显著影响模型在估算表面通量时的准确性，尤其是在强烈的平流环境中。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What are the reasons for the difficulties faced in measuring energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in arid and semi-arid regions?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在干旱和半干旱地区，测量能量、水蒸气和碳交换所面临的困难原因有哪些？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Arid and semi-arid regions face ecological degradation challenges such as drying of rivers and lakes and increased land desertification, which complicate the measurement of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange. These issues are exacerbated by the need for long-term observations to understand oasis-desert interactions and maintain ecological stability.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 干旱和半干旱地区面临生态退化的挑战，如河流和湖泊干涸以及土地沙漠化加剧，这使得能量、水汽和碳交换的测量变得复杂。这些问题因需要长期观察以理解绿洲与沙漠的相互作用和维持生态稳定而加剧。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: Why is it important to implement long-term observational datasets in oasis–desert systems for energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange studies?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠系统中实施长期观测数据集对于能量、水汽和碳交换研究的重要性是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: Understanding the basic characteristics of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems is essential to achieve goals related to carbon peaking and carbon neutrality in these areas. Long-term observations support ecological security and sustainable development by providing crucial data to protect the ecological stability and socioeconomic development of oases.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 了解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水汽和碳交换的基本特征，对于实现这些地区的碳达峰和碳中和目标至关重要。长期观测通过提供关键数据来支持生态安全和可持续发展，以保护绿洲的生态稳定性和社会经济发展。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What are the objectives of using a two-source energy balance model to estimate evapotranspiration components in heterogeneous land surfaces?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 使用双源能量平衡模型估计异质地表蒸散发成分的目标是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The objectives include estimating evaporation (E), transpiration (T), and evapotranspiration (ET) using soil and canopy component temperatures. This approach is validated with observed ratios using stable isotopes and eddy covariance (EC) system measurements, aiming to improve the accuracy of surface energy balance assessments in areas with mixed soil and vegetation.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 目标包括利用土壤和冠层组件温度估算蒸发（E）、蒸腾（T）和蒸散（ET）。该方法通过使用稳定同位素和涡度协方差（EC）系统测量的观测比率进行验证，旨在提高在混合土壤和植被区域的表面能量平衡评估的准确性。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: Why is it critical to maintain a balance between oasis and desert systems in arid and semi-arid regions?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 为什么在干旱和半干旱地区保持绿洲和沙漠系统之间的平衡至关重要？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: Maintaining this balance is crucial for sustainable development since oases serve as the ecological and economic backbone of these regions. They support more than 90% of the population in arid areas, and understanding their energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange dynamics is vital for ecological security and sustainable development.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 维持这种平衡对可持续发展至关重要，因为绿洲是这些地区生态和经济的支柱。它们支持超过90%的干旱地区人口，理解它们的能量、水汽和碳交换动态对生态安全和可持续发展至关重要。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What are the key steps involved in setting up and maintaining an automatic weather station for collecting hydrometeorological data in mixed forest areas?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 在混合森林区域设置和维护自动气象站以收集水文气象数据的关键步骤是什么？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: The setup involves installing various sensors at different heights and orientations, such as air temperature and humidity sensors at 28m facing north, barometers in ground-level anti-tamper boxes, and rain gauges at 28m. Wind speed and direction sensors are also at 28m facing north, while a four-component radiometer and infrared thermometers are at 24m facing south. Soil temperature and moisture probes are buried at various depths and distances from the meteorological tower. Data processing includes ensuring 144 data points per day, removing duplicates, and discarding values that exceed physical limits or instrument ranges.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 该设置涉及在不同高度和方向安装各种传感器，例如在28米高的北面安装空气温度和湿度传感器，在地面防篡改箱中安装气压计，以及在28米高处安装雨量计。风速和风向传感器也位于28米高的北面，而四分量辐射计和红外温度计则位于24米高的南面。土壤温度和湿度探头埋设在不同深度和距离气象塔的位置。数据处理包括确保每天144个数据点，去除重复数据，并丢弃超过物理限制或仪器范围的值。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What procedures are followed to ensure data quality and control in long-term energy and water vapor flux observations in oasis–desert systems?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠系统中，确保长期能源和水汽通量观测的数据质量和控制所遵循的程序是什么？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: Data quality is maintained through a multi-step process involving data collection, processing, and archiving. This includes measuring fluxes with eddy covariance systems and scintillometers, and collecting hydrometeorological data using automatic weather stations. The stations record variables like radiation, soil heat flux, temperature gradients, wind speed, and soil moisture at regular intervals. Quality control involves checking data consistency, addressing missing values, and ensuring correct formatting for archival and sharing purposes.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 数据质量通过一个多步骤的过程得以维护，包括数据收集、处理和归档。这包括使用涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪测量通量，以及使用自动气象站收集水文气象数据。这些站点定期记录辐射、土壤热通量、温度梯度、风速和土壤湿度等变量。质量控制涉及检查数据的一致性、处理缺失值，并确保归档和共享时的正确格式。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What conditions or resources enable the accurate partitioning of evapotranspiration into evaporation and transpiration in heterogeneous landscapes?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 哪些条件或资源能够在异质景观中准确地将蒸散发分为蒸发和蒸腾？
Enablement.AnswerEn: The use of ground-measured soil and canopy component temperatures, high-resolution thermal camera data, and techniques like the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotope methodology enable accurate partitioning of evapotranspiration into evaporation and transpiration.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 使用地面测量的土壤和冠层组分温度、高分辨率热像仪数据以及稳定氧和氢同位素方法等技术，可以准确地将蒸散发分为蒸发和蒸腾。

Enablement.QuestionEn: In what ways do technological advancements and data processing techniques enhance the accuracy of hydrometeorological observations in arid regions?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 技术进步和数据处理技术通过哪些方式提高了干旱地区水文气象观测的准确性？
Enablement.AnswerEn: Technological advancements such as automatic weather stations with a 10 min average period for measuring hydrometeorological data, along with comprehensive data processing and quality control procedures, enhance the accuracy of observations in arid regions.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 技术进步，如具有10分钟平均周期的自动气象站用于测量水文气象数据，以及全面的数据处理和质量控制程序，提高了干旱地区观测的准确性。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might a dataset in this field struggle to accurately capture soil and canopy component temperatures in arid regions?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 在干旱地区，数据集可能难以准确捕捉土壤和树冠组件温度的原因是什么？
Expectation.AnswerEn: The current composite temperature separation approaches are limited in their effectiveness in arid regions. Errors in the derived component temperature were primarily caused by image classification errors, which varied with vegetation abundance. Additionally, ignoring atmospheric upwelling radiation and transmittance could contribute to uncertainties in the estimated temperatures.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 当前的复合温度分离方法在干旱地区的有效性有限。推导的组成温度的误差主要是由于图像分类错误造成的，这些错误随着植被丰度的变化而变化。此外，忽略大气向上辐射和透射率可能会导致估计温度的不确定性。

Expectation.QuestionEn: What could be some reasons for the high uncertainty in estimating surface fluxes in strongly advective irrigated agricultural areas?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 在强对流灌溉农业区估算地表通量不确定性高的原因可能是什么？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Accurately estimating surface fluxes in such areas is challenging due to an incomplete energy balance closure with respect to available energy and the uncertainty in surface-air temperature difference. This uncertainty is often dominant due to errors in determining the surface soil and vegetation component temperatures from surface composite radiometric temperature.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 在这些区域准确估计表面通量是具有挑战性的，因为可用能量的能量平衡闭合不完全，以及表面与空气温度差的不确定性。由于从表面复合辐射温度中确定表层土壤和植被组分温度的误差，这种不确定性通常是主导因素。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might the data collection methods in oasis-desert systems face challenges in terms of ecological environment degradation?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 为什么绿洲-沙漠系统中的数据收集方法在生态环境退化方面可能面临挑战？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Inland river basins in arid and semiarid areas are facing ecological environment degradation, such as the drying up of rivers and lakes, degradation of natural vegetation, intensification of land desertification, and frequent dust storms. These challenges can impact the accuracy and reliability of data collection methods in oasis-desert systems.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 内陆河流流域在干旱和半干旱地区面临生态环境退化的问题，例如河流和湖泊干涸、自然植被退化、土地沙漠化加剧以及频繁的沙尘暴。这些挑战可能会影响绿洲-沙漠系统中数据收集方法的准确性和可靠性。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: How do you evaluate the effectiveness of the data collection methods used for monitoring hydrometeorological variables in mixed forest ecosystems?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 如何评估用于监测混合森林生态系统中水文气象变量的数据收集方法的有效性？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: The data collection methods involve a comprehensive setup with various sensors positioned at strategic heights and orientations, such as air temperature and humidity sensors at 28m with a northward orientation, and radiation instruments at 24m facing south. These methods ensure wide coverage of meteorological parameters but require thorough quality control to address potential data gaps and sensor errors, as indicated by missing data due to sensor issues.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 数据收集方法涉及一个综合设置，配备了各种传感器，按战略高度和方向布置，例如，28米高的空气温度和湿度传感器朝北方向，24米高的辐射仪器朝南。这些方法确保了气象参数的广泛覆盖，但需要进行彻底的质量控制，以解决潜在的数据缺口和传感器错误，正如由于传感器问题导致的缺失数据所示。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: What challenges might arise in ensuring the accuracy and reliability of evapotranspiration models in strongly advective irrigated agricultural areas, and how can these be addressed?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 在强对流灌溉农业区域，确保蒸散发模型的准确性和可靠性可能会面临哪些挑战，以及如何解决这些问题？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: Challenges include errors in surface-air temperature differences and classification errors in image data, leading to overestimated component temperatures. Addressing these challenges involves refining temperature separation methods and improving the classification accuracy of soil and canopy pixels to enhance model reliability.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 挑战包括地表与空气温度差异的错误以及图像数据中的分类错误，这导致组件温度被高估。解决这些挑战需要改进温度分离方法，并提高土壤和树冠像素的分类准确性，以增强模型的可靠性。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I don't understand how data collection methods in this domain ensure the accuracy and reliability of soil and canopy temperature measurements.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我不明白该领域的数据收集方法如何确保土壤和冠层温度测量的准确性和可靠性。
Assertion.AnswerEn: In the field, methods such as using high-resolution thermal cameras to obtain soil and canopy component temperatures and validating these through radiometric temperature comparisons ensure accuracy. Ground-based measurements supplement these observations, and data is processed with quality control steps to handle classification errors and uncertainties.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 在该领域，使用高分辨率热像仪获取土壤和冠层组件温度，并通过辐射温度比较进行验证的方法确保了准确性。地面测量补充了这些观察数据，并通过质量控制步骤处理分类错误和不确定性。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I'm unsure about the challenges faced when collecting data in arid and semiarid regions, particularly regarding energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我对在干旱和半干旱地区收集数据时面临的挑战感到不确定，特别是在能源、水汽和碳交换方面。
Assertion.AnswerEn: Challenges in these regions include environmental degradation such as drying rivers and lakes, land desertification, and frequent dust storms. Accurate data collection requires overcoming these conditions, which affect the balance between oasis and desert systems and require comprehensive datasets to understand energy and carbon exchanges.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 这些地区面临的挑战包括环境退化，如河流和湖泊干涸、土地沙漠化以及频繁的沙尘暴。准确的数据收集需要克服这些条件，这些条件影响着绿洲和沙漠系统之间的平衡，并需要全面的数据集来理解能量和碳的交换。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I can't make sense of how datasets from oasis–desert systems are structured and what parameters are typically included to study hydrometeorological processes.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我无法理解来自绿洲-沙漠系统的数据集是如何结构化的，以及通常包含哪些参数来研究水文气象过程。
Assertion.AnswerEn: Datasets are structured to include long-term energy, water vapor, carbon, and methane fluxes, along with auxiliary data like radiation, soil heat flux, temperature profiles, and gradients of various meteorological factors. Vegetation and soil parameters are also incorporated to provide a comprehensive view of oasis–desert interactions.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 数据集结构包括长期的能量、水蒸气、碳和甲烷通量，以及辐射、土壤热通量、温度剖面和各种气象因素的梯度等辅助数据。还纳入了植被和土壤参数，以提供对绿洲-沙漠相互作用的全面视角。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please provide an overview of data collection methods used for hydrometeorological observations in ecosystems where both natural and artificial landscapes coexist.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请提供在自然和人工景观共存的生态系统中用于水文气象观测的数据收集方法概述。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Hydrometeorological data in combined natural and artificial landscapes is collected using automatic weather stations. These stations record radiation, soil heat flux, soil temperature profiles, gradients of air temperature and humidity, wind speed and direction, air pressure, precipitation, and soil moisture profiles with a 10-minute averaging period. Additionally, turbulent flux data is captured by an eddy covariance system and scintillometer, with vegetation and soil parameters being supplemented in the datasets.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 在自然和人工景观相结合的地区，使用自动气象站收集水文气象数据。这些气象站记录辐射、土壤热通量、土壤温度剖面、空气温度和湿度梯度、风速和风向、气压、降水量以及土壤湿度剖面，平均时间为10分钟。此外，涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪还捕获湍流通量数据，并在数据集中补充植被和土壤参数。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please summarize the challenges associated with accurately separating soil and canopy component temperatures in remote sensing data collection for evapotranspiration estimation.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn:
在遥感数据收集中，准确分离土壤和冠层成分温度以估算蒸散发面临的挑战包括： 

1. **混合信号**：土壤和植物冠层的温度信号常常混合在一起，难以单独提取。
2. **空间异质性**：不同地表特征（如植被覆盖、土壤类型）导致温度分布不均，增加了分离的复杂性。
3. **时间变化**：温度随时间变化，尤其是在日间，土壤和冠层的热响应不同，需考虑动态变化。
4. **传感器限制**：遥感仪器的分辨率和精度可能不足以捕捉到细微的温度差异。
5. **环境因素**：气象条件（如风速、湿度）对温度测量有影响，可能干扰土壤和冠层温度的准确分离。

这些挑战使得在遥感数据中准确估算蒸散发变得复杂。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Challenges in accurately separating soil and canopy component temperatures for evapotranspiration estimation include image classification errors that vary with vegetation abundance, leading to misclassification of soil pixels as vegetation pixels. This results in overestimation of canopy temperature, particularly under developing vegetation conditions. Furthermore, neglecting atmospheric upwelling radiation and transmittance can introduce uncertainties in temperature estimates, and errors in incoming short- and long-wave radiation transmittances through the canopy may also affect the accuracy of net radiation (Rn) estimation.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 准确分离土壤和冠层组分温度以估算蒸散发面临的挑战包括图像分类错误，这些错误随着植被丰度的变化而变化，导致土壤像素被误分类为植被像素。这会导致冠层温度的过高估计，特别是在植被发育阶段。此外，忽视大气上行辐射和透射率可能会引入温度估计的不确定性，而通过冠层的入射短波和长波辐射的透射率错误也可能影响净辐射（Rn）估计的准确性。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please identify potential datasets that can be utilized for studying energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请识别可以用于研究绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水蒸气和碳交换的潜在数据集。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Potential datasets for studying energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems include long-term observational datasets from artificial and natural oasis-desert systems. These datasets contain energy, water vapor, carbon, and methane fluxes, along with auxiliary data involving hydrometeorology, vegetation, and soil parameters. Data is available from 11 land surface flux and meteorological stations established since 2012, including 2 superstations and 9 ordinary stations, which are freely accessible from the National Tibetan Plateau Data Center.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 研究绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水汽和碳交换的潜在数据集包括来自人工和自然绿洲-沙漠系统的长期观测数据集。这些数据集包含能量、水汽、碳和甲烷通量，以及涉及水文气象、植被和土壤参数的辅助数据。自2012年以来建立的11个地表通量和气象站提供的数据，包括2个超级站和9个普通站，这些数据可以从国家西藏高原数据中心免费获取。
